column1: Title: State Data and Policy Actions to Address Coronavirus | The Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation

column2: Statewide (14); Affected Counties (2); High-risk Groups (7); No Action (28)
column3: All Non-Essential Businesses (21); All Non-Essential Retail Businesses (3); Other (2); No Action (25)
column4: All Gatherings Prohibited (12); >10 Prohibited (24); 25+ Prohibited (1); 50+ Prohibited (4); Other (2); No action (8)
column6: Closed except for takeout/delivery (43); Limited on-site service (4); Other (1); No action (5)

column1: For purposes of this table, states were included if they mandated the listed actions. A number of states released guidance or recommendations related to the actions listed in this table but fell short of issuing a requirement and are thus not included.
1. Closes non-essential businesses in two affected boroughs.
2. While the CA governor has not officially mandated the statewide closure of schools, the state's mandatory quarantine order effectively closes all schools.
3. All non-essential businesses must reduce in-person workforce by at least 50%.
4. Please see links in Sources tab for more details.
5. Nebraska has enacted a large gatherings ban, school closure, and bar/restaurant limits in counties where community spread has been confirmed.
6. Gatherings also limited to 50% of venue capacity if such limitation would be under 50 people.
